research_goal.title: Immunotherapy Resistance Mechanisms
research_goal.description: Understand mechanisms of resistance to checkpoint inhibitor immunotherapy. Generate testable hypotheses that can be refined through iterative scientist feedback.

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 1 (Literature-based): Biomedicine/Immuno-Oncology Mechanism
hypotheses.description: Generated from synthesizing literature on Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology. This hypothesis proposes a novel mechanism integrating existing research.
hypotheses.mechanism: Building on current understanding of Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology, this mechanism suggests that the key pathway involves cross-disciplinary integration of molecular and systems-level effects.
testable_predictions: Prediction 1: Observable effect in Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology context
grounding_evidence: Wang et al. (2023) - Supporting pathway analysis

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 2 (Assumption-based): Novel Target in Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology
hypotheses.description: Generated through systematic assumption identification in Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology.
hypotheses.mechanism: Logical chain: If assumption X holds → intermediate effect Y → final outcome Z

hypotheses.title: Hypothesis 3 (Analogy-based): Cross-domain Mechanism for Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology
hypotheses.description: Analogous to mechanisms in related domains, proposing novel application to Biomedicine/Immuno-oncology
hypotheses.mechanism: The mechanism discovered in Domain A may apply to Domain B through structural similarity
